intro: Moonia quadribracteata, commonly known as the four-bract moonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, with four bracts surrounding each inflorescence. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
